quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Music and Quotes
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Its always been my dream to come to Madison Square Garden and be the opening act for Elvis. Which of these people does this quote belong to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Al Gore

questions.question: I hate music , especially when its played. Who said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Durante

questions.question: Which of these quotes belongs to Ludwig van Beethoven?

options.text: The whole problem can be stated quite simply by asking,Is there a meaning to music? My answer would be Yes. And can you state it in so many words what the meaning is?  And  my  answer to this  would be No.
Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy. Music is the electrical soil in which the spirit lives thinks and invents.
Anything that is too stupid to be said is sung.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy. Music is the electrical soil in which the spirit lives thinks and invents.

questions.question: I am not handsome but when  women hear me play they come  crawling. Who said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Niccolo Paganini

questions.question: It seems like musicians want to sell a few records and put out a perfume line, and I think its so sad that there are so many musicians, who dont want to change  the world... Music has  been so much more. Which of these performers said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moby

questions.question: If life were fair, Elvis would be alive and the impersonators dead. Which of these comedians said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Carson

questions.question: Which of these wrote Aunt Marion was right. Never marry a musician and never answer the door. ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Schultz

questions.question: Who said Silence is  more musical than any song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Rossetti

questions.question: Music is the shorthand of emotion. This quotation belongs to which famous artist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Tolstoy

questions.question: Which of these quotes belongs to Bob Marley.

options.text: One good thing about music. When it hits  you, you feel no pain.
If I am not making music , I have no reason for existing.
Good music is good music, and everything else can go to hell.
Its okay for musicians not to be womanizers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One good thing about music. When it hits  you, you feel no pain.

questions.question: Which of these quotes belongs to Billy Joel?

options.text: Canned music is like audible wallpaper.
A typical day in the life of a heavy metal musician consists of a round of golf and an AA meeting.
This land is your land and this land is my land, sure, but the world is run by people, that never listen to music anyway.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A typical day in the life of a heavy metal musician consists of a round of golf and an AA meeting.

questions.question: There are two kinds of music, the good and the bad. I play the good kind. Who said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Armstrong

questions.question: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace. Which of these famous musicians said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi  Hendrix

questions.question: The following quote belongs to this famous musician: Whenever society gets  too stifling and the rules get too complex, theres some sort of musical explosion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slash

questions.question: People today are still living off the table scraps of the sixties. They are still being passed around - the music and the ideas. Who said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Dylan

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Fergie and Wedding
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, opening, fergies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With which band did Fergie make her music debut?

options.text: She debuted as a solo artist.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild Orchid

questions.question: Which legendary musician said the following: I always wanted the  sound of Muddy Waters early records - only louder.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Clapton

questions.question: The shoes that Fergie wore at her wedding in 2009 were designed by Jimmy Choo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who did Fergie marry in early 2009?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josh Duhamel

questions.question: What is the full name of singer and actress Fergie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stacy Ann Ferguson

questions.question: In what 2009 musical film does Fergie from the Black Eyed Peas play a character named Saraghina?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nine

questions.question: Which of these artists does the following quote belong to: Jazz came to America three hundred  years ago in chains.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Whiteman

questions.question: When did Amy Lee and Ben Moody, the founding members of Evanescence, first meet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1994

questions.question: In 2007, Fergie won a Peoples Choice Award in 2007 for Best Female Video.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How much did the wedding cake for Fergies 2009 wedding ceremony weigh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 68 kg

questions.question: Jazz is the only music, in which the same note can be played night after night but differently each time. Who said this?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ornette Coleman

questions.question: Who designed the wedding dress Fergie wore when she married in January 2009?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolce and Gabanna

questions.question: How many Billboard Hot 100 hits did Fergie have with her debut solo album, The Dutchess?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: Which hit movie did Fergie write the opening song for?

options.text: Hes Just Not That Into You

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sex and the City

questions.question: The memory of things  gone is important to a  jazz musician. Things like old  folks singing in the moonlight in the backyard on a hot   night or  something said  long ago. This quote belongs to which of these performers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis Armstrong

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Mandy Moore and Soul
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, eps, soul. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What actress appeared in Mandy Moores Candy video?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scarlett Johansson

questions.question: What famous band has been called the Fab Four?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: What number was Mandy Moore ranked in Stuff magazines 102 Sexiest  Women in the World?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 67

questions.question: Which of the following men has Mandy Moore dated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What legendary composer has been called the Father of Modern Music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mozart

questions.question: What popular male musician was dubbed the King of Rock and Roll?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What American soul singer was nicknamed the Empress of Soul?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladys Knight

questions.question: This female singer with amazing vocal abilities was dubbed the Voice.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whitney Houston

questions.question: What does evanescence mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: disappearance

questions.question: Mandy Moore has her own fashion line.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Is it true that singer/songwriter Amy Lee wrote the songs Like You and Hello for her late younger sister.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: How many EPs did Evanescence record in the period 1998-2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: three

questions.question: What nickname was given to Frank Sinatra?

questions.question: Mandy Moore lent her voice to this 2006 animated Disney movie?

questions.question: Which of the following movies did Mandy Moore not appear in?

options.text: I Know What You Did Last Summer

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Know What You Did Last Summer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Video and Music
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What American female musician was nicknamed the Queen of Rock and Roll?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What actress was featured in Will Smiths very pricey music video Miami in 1998?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eva Mendes

questions.question: In what type of accident does Celine Dion lose her lover in her 1996 superexpensive music video Its All Coming Back to Me Now?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Motorcycle crash

questions.question: What nickname was given to Ella Fitzgerald to honor her talent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Lady of Song

questions.question: What famous actor was featured as a live reporter in the 1998 music video Victory by Sean Combs, a.k.a. Puff Daddy, P. Diddy, or just Diddy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danny DeVito

questions.question: Who does Mariah Carey fight with in her 1999 music video Heartbreaker, which is among the most expensive music videos of all time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An evil version of herself

questions.question: What celebrated movie director worked on Michael Jacksons 1987 music video Bad?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Scorsese

questions.question: What 1989 song by Madonna contains the lyrics Dont go for second best baby, put your love to the test, and has one of the most expensive videos in history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Express Yourself

questions.question: Which of these nicknames has been given to Prince?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His Royal Badness

questions.question: Who performed the song Die Another Day featured on the soundtrack of the 2002 James Bond movie Die Another Day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madonna

questions.question: The black-and-white video for this 1995 song by Michael and Janet Jackson cost millions of dollars, and was nominated for eleven MTV Video Music Awards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scream

questions.question: What popular boyband performed the 1999 song Larger than Life, whose video had a million-dollar budget?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Backstreet Boys

questions.question: Ive Been Flushed From the Bathroom of Your Heart is performed on this artists album recorded at Folsom Prison. You probably didnt know he sang this but a couple of his famous songs are Ring of Fire and I Walked the Line. Who is this Man in Black?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash

questions.question: What famous American rapper was dubbed the King of Rap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snoop Dogg

questions.question: What does James Brown request from MC Hammer in the 1991 music video Too Legit to Quit, one of the priciest music videos in history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jacksons glove

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Bass
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocalist, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The song Wake from Linkin Parks album Minutes to Midnight is the bands traditional instrumental track on the album. What is the albums name in reference to?

options.text: Time until President Bush is out of office

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Time until nuclear catastrophe

questions.question: When did vocalist Michael Kiske join power metal band Helloween?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in 1986

questions.question: This guitarist, who wrote the track Oernst Of Life, is one of the founding members of heavy metal band Helloween.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Weikath

questions.question: Which of these is a real country rock group from the 70s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eggs Over Easy

questions.question: Isaac Dickie Freeman is a Black gospel bass that wrote, arranged and sang bass for this gospel group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fairfield Four

questions.question: In 1984, Hellowen recorded two songs for which Noise Records compilation project?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death Metal

questions.question: Remember this short named song I Was Looking Back To See If You Were Looking Back To See If I Was Looking Back To See If You Were Looking Back At Me. Do you also remember the colorfully named singer to whom it is attributed? If so, tell me.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Ed Brown

questions.question: His most famous song is Mr. Bojangles which is not about the famous dancer Bill Robinson. He later sang a song called Up Against the Wall Redneck Mother written by Ray Wylie Hubbard. Hes one of those country artists like Ray Wylie Hubbard who uses his full name. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Jeff Walker

questions.question: German band Helloween was formed in the early 1980s, in which city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamburg

questions.question: My Give-a-Damns Busted was written and performed by an artist who is known for his ballads and novelty songs. His platinum albums include Honky Tonk Attitude and Third Rock From the Sun. His longest running number one song is Pickup Man. Methinks his name rhymes with a river running through Dublin. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Diffie

questions.question: Tequila Makes Her Clothes Fall Off would seem to sound like a top ten song from Mexico but it reached number 1 on the US Billboard Hot Country Hits in 2005. Who was the money sounding man that sang it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Nichols

questions.question: He sang bass for this family. His mom and dad sang, too, as did his two sisters and his brother Ben.  His first name was Jackson, but everyone knew him by his middle name, Brock. What was the name of the family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speer

questions.question: Heres a mouthful of a song title - Dixie Rose Deluxes Honky Tonk, Feed Store, Gun Shop, Used Car, Beer, Bait, BBQ, Barber Shop, Laundromat. His initials are T.W. Who sang it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trent Willmon

questions.question: Had too much beer? If so you might learn the lyrics to I Never Went to Bed With an Ugly Woman (But I Sure Woke Up With a Few). Although Willie Nelson recorded it, the song was written and first recorded by this artist whose career began in 1958. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby Bare

questions.question: Youre the Reason Our Kids Are Ugly was sung by Loretta Lynn in a duet with another country artist who was her longtime professional partner. If you remember the song Its Only Make Believe then you know this man who supposedly derived his stage name from a town in Texas and one in Arkansas. Who is this Hello Darlin singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Conway Twitty

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Album

questions.question: The song Given Up from Linkin Parks album Minutes to Midnight is the first Linkin Park song to feature profanity in the lyrics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which one of these is not a Sizzla song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fire Pon Rome

questions.question: The song Shadow Of The Day from Linkin Parks album Minutes To Midnight was the third single from the album. What unusual occurrence takes place most times that the band plays the song live?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chester Bennington plays guitar

questions.question: As of the release of their album Minutes to Midnight, Linkin Parks song In Between is the only song that features Mike Shinoda singing and not rapping.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The song What Ive Done from Linkin Parks album Minutes to Midnight was the last song written for the album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Jamaican reggae musician Sizzla has been banned from the United Kingdom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What name meaning victorious was adopted by reggae musician Sizzla?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kalonji

questions.question: What was the first idea for the title of the song Valentines Day from Linkin Parks album Minutes To Midnight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love and Sadness

questions.question: The song No More Sorrow from Linkin Parks album Minutes to Midnight was featured on the game Guitar Hero III.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Linkin Park views the song Little Things Give You Away from their album Minutes to Midnight as the pinnacle effort of their entire career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The song Hands Held High from Linkin Parks album Minutes To Midnight is about which American war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The war in Iraq

questions.question: The song In Pieces from Linkin Parks album Minutes to Midnight features what kind of musical interlude not common to the bands previous songs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guitar Solo

questions.question: What is unusual about the music video of the song Bleed It Out from Linkin Parks album Minutes To Midnight?

options.text: The band members are playing the wrong instruments

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Everyone is moving backwards

questions.question: Sizzlas dreadlocks have never been seen on his album covers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is Sizzlas birth name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miguel Orlando Collins
